item.title: Ticket #1821 (Is WordPress available in unzipped file?-> Answer) closed
item.dc:creator: Potter_System
item.description:
invalid:

WordPress has more than 150 files inside, so at this moment the best way for get it is using ZIP or TAR files.

If you are using Windows XP, open the file with the integrated Windows unzipper (right clic in WordPress ZIP file, go to Open with and search for "zip" beside the other program; I don't have English Windows to tell you exactly where to clic)

And please, next time go to WordPress Forums.

item.title: Ticket #1821 (Is WordPress available in unzipped file?-> Answer) created
item.dc:creator: kensmith
item.description: I'm a Mac user, but I'm trying to get WordPress installed on a friend's Windows XP computer. I downloaded, but got a message that I was 585 days beyond the trial periood for the unzipper. It's such a small file, why zip it? Is it available anywhere as a straight download? Thanks

item.title: Ticket #1819 (extra <a href="http://www.LINK.org" /> links "Posted in") created
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description:
please do the following - i could reproduce the issue at kishore.wordpress.com as well as a local install

1) write post

2) title: testing

3) body:

3-a) type: kishore

3-b) mark: kishore

3-c) click on "insert/edit link"

3-d) for the url, enter: â€‹http://www.kishore.org

3-d) press END ( to reach end of word )

-> you are now at next line

3-e) type: kishore1

3-f) publish

EDIT the entry and see the html -> it contains 

<p><a href="http://www.kishore.org">kishore.org</a></p>
<p>kishore </p>
<a href="http://www.kishore.org" />

the third line is unexpected and seems to be a bug !

item.title: Ticket #1593 (Fixing the "From" address on all emails.) updated

item.title: Ticket #1818 (A not-closed <a> tag does not get corrected in comments) created
item.dc:creator: tjaard
item.description: Today I got a comment on my blog and the person who wrote the comment did not completely understand the <a> tag, forgetting to close it. WP did not correct this, leading to a yellow screen because of malformed XML (I serve XHTML with the correct mime type). Even if standard WP installations use text/html and therefore the user won't get parse errors, it is not acceptable that ordinary visitors can screw up a blog's markup, as using text/html as a mime type will probably still show the remaining text of the blog as a link.

item.title: Ticket #1593 (Fixing the "From" address on all emails.) reopened
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
I'm not convinced this is fixed so reopening.

wp_notify_postauthor in â€‹trunk/wp-includes/pluggable-functions.php calls wp_mail() with a non-blank headers which includes already a From: line with the commenters email address in it: 

        if ('' == $comment->comment_author_email || '' == $comment->comment_author) {
                $from = "From: \"$blogname\" <wordpress@" . $_SERVER['SERVER_NAME'] . '>';
        } else {
                $from = 'From: "' . $comment->comment_author . "\" <$comment->comment_author_email>";
        }
        $message_headers = "MIME-Version: 1.0\n"
                . "$from\n"
                . "Content-Type: text/plain; charset=\"" . get_settings('blog_charset') . "\"\n";

item.title: Ticket #1817 (Protection against multiple trackbacks in one bunch) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
When processing Trackbacks, duplicates are not eliminated.

Patch adds pinged URIs to in-hand copy of pinged URIs as they are pinged, so that there can be no duplicate pings.

Thanks to Kamigoroshi for pointing out this bug in #wordpress to me

item.title: Ticket #1816 (Link Category before/after settings nonfunctional) created
item.dc:creator: Dachannien
item.description:
There are settings in the site admin panel (Links/Link Categories) for code to insert before and after each link as well as between the link and the description. While the option is properly inserted into the database, it is never used by get_links_list() in wp-includes/links.php .

The solution is simple - modify the db query in get_links_list() to ask for the three additional fields: 

$cats = $wpdb->get_results("
            SELECT DISTINCT link_category, cat_name, show_images,
            show_description, show_rating, show_updated, sort_order,
            sort_desc, list_limit,
            text_before_link, text_after_link, text_after_all
            FROM `$wpdb->links`  ...

and then use those values in the call to get_links: 

            get_links($cat['link_category'],
                 $cat['text_before_link'],
                 $cat['text_after_all'],
                 $cat['text_after_link'],   ...

item.title: Ticket #993 (Post pings itself on updating) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Status changed

item.title: Ticket #993 (Post pings itself on updating) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Owner, Status changed

item.title: Ticket #993 (Post pings itself on updating) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Keywords, Milestone changed

Patch prevents this on both ends.

When sending Pingbacks, it will not send a Pingback to itself.

When receiving Pingbacks, it will not register a Pingback from itself. (Lest a crapflooder use this to make every entry on someone's blog ping itself to cause mischief.)

item.dc:creator: nilsjeppe
item.description: It seems that trackbacks send "messy" URLs and not the correct permalinks. Needless to say, this is not such a great idea, especially since one can hardly change trackbacks after they have been sent. Yes, it still works, but it's absolutely unclean, and it may break compatibility if I change my software in the future but keep my URL layout (the "permanent" part of Permalinks).

item.title: Ticket #1811 (possible bug in kubrick default template breaks images with custom ...) created
item.dc:creator: jbwhong
item.description:
Hello everyone.

Please accept my apologies if this is not an actual bug. I was looking for someplace (the wiki, perhaps?) to discuss this before submission, but was unable to locate such a place.

THE SETUP:

Using default theme version 1.5

Custom permalink structure is:

/index.php/archives/%year%/%monthnum%/%day%/%postname%/

THE PROBLEM

Permalinks work, but if you visit a page, images break. For example, I posted three images to:

â€‹http://jason.whong.org/index.php/archives/2005/11/01/creating-a-music-bed-in-imovie/

And the three images don't load. (If you visit the page, I am now using a modified Jillij 1 theme.

THE FIX:

The (almost) fix was found at the codex:

â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/9261

By adding the following to header.php, I fixed the images:

<?php

$basehref = "â€‹http://".$_SERVER['SERVER_NAME'].($_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME']); ?>

<base href="<?php echo"$basehref"; ?>">

HOWEVER:

But as the author of Jillij, JÃ©rÃ´me, pointed out to me, this change causes another feature to break. If you click on the link directly above each comment, it now goes to index.php.

Example: under Wordpress Default without the base href mod, the link above comment 493 in my blog points to the correct spot. (â€‹http://jason.whong.org/index.php/archives/2005/11/01/creating-a-music-bed-in-imovie/#comment-493) With the fix, the link now goes to (â€‹http://jason.whong.org/index.php/#comment-493). So my fix is not really a fix at all.

I don't believe I had this problem with 1.2, but it has been a long time for me, so I don't really know. Again, please accept my apologies if I reported this one in error. Apologies also for not locating a list of severity ratings and their definition before selecting a severity. I picked "major" because it appears to break something that should work.
